main event: A bright, round, luminous object was observed hovering over Tiffin, Ohio on November 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object appeared to be round in shape, approximately 30 to 50 feet in diameter, and had a bright, luminous glow with a metallic surface.
The object was observed hovering at an estimated altitude of 1000 to 2000 feet for approximately 10 minutes before disappearing from sight.
Several other citizens in Tiffin also reported observing the unidentified object in the sky.
The USAF radar facility at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base and the Ohio National Guard reported no aircraft in the Tiffin area during the incident.
The report includes three photographs, one of which depicts a mysterious spherical object and another that shows a damaged or disassembled device or mechanism.
witnesses: Mr. John Smith and several other citizens
photographs: yes, the report includes three photographs
